thread.title: 'Don't Hang Up': Springsteen trolls POTUS at Melbourne gig
thread.title_full: 'Don't Hang Up': Springsteen trolls POTUS at Melbourne gig

title: 'Don't Hang Up': Springsteen trolls POTUS at Melbourne gig
text:
Bruce Springsteen trolls Donald Trump's phone call with Malcolm Turnbull during Melbourne concert Posted February 03, 2017 10:24:57 Map: Melbourne 3000 
Bruce Springsteen has mocked the reportedly hostile phone call between US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull during his latest show in Melbourne. 
"We stand before you embarrassed Americans," Springsteen said, before launching into a cover of 60s song Don't Hang Up. 
"We're going to use this to send a letter back home." 
The cover song was seen as a jab at the shorter-than-planned phone call between Mr Trump and Mr Turnbull, during which the US President reportedly accused the Prime Minister of seeking to export the "next Boston bombers" to the US. 
Some of the lyrics in the track by The Orlons include: 
Don't hang up like you always do; 
I know you think our love is true; 
I'll explain the facts to you, don't hang up. 
Springsteen, an outspoken critic of Mr Trump, has been touring in Australia for close to two weeks, but this is not the first time he has weighed in on US politics during his travels. External Link: Bruce Springsteen Facebook: "America is a nation of immigrants and we find this anti-democratic and fundamentally un-American." 
In Adelaide Springsteen spoke out against Mr Trump's controversial announcement to temporarily ban immigration from seven Muslim-majority countries, affecting Iraq, Syria, Iran, Libya, Somalia, Sudan and Yemen. 
"Tonight, we want to add our voices to the thousands of Americans who are protesting at airports around our country the Muslim ban and the detention of foreign nationals and refugees," Springsteen said to the crowd earlier in the week. 
"America is a nation of immigrants."
